text: The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.
author: George Orwell

text: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.
author: Mark Twain

text: Until one has loved an animal, a part of one's soul remains unawakened.
author: Anatole France

text: Man is the only animal for whom his own existence is a problem which he has to solve.
author: Erich Fromm

text: Heaven goes by favor. If it went by merit, you would stay out and your dog would go in.
author: Mark Twain

text: The fox knows many things, but the hedgehog knows one big thing.
author: Archilochus

text: I think I could turn and live with animals, they are so placid and self-contained.
author: Walt Whitman

text: A dog has no use for fancy cars, big homes, or designer clothes. A waterlogged stick will do just fine.
author: John Grogan

text: Never break a promise to an animal. They’re like babies—they won’t understand.
author: Tamora Pierce

text: An animal’s eyes have the power to speak a great language.
author: Martin Buber

text: Even the smallest feline is a masterpiece.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Dogs are our link to paradise.
author: Milan Kundera

text: Some people talk to animals. Not many listen though. That's the problem.
author: A.A. Milne

text: The only creatures that are evolved enough to convey pure love are dogs and infants.
author: Johnny Depp

text: It is much easier to show compassion to animals. They are never wicked.
author: Haile Selassie

text: When I look into the eyes of an animal, I do not see an animal. I see a living being. I see a friend.
author: Anthony Douglas Williams

text: We can judge the heart of a man by his treatment of animals.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: A bird does not sing because it has an answer, it sings because it has a song.
author: Maya Angelou

text: No matter how little money and how few possessions you own, having a dog makes you rich.
author: Louis Sabin

text: Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog, it's too dark to read.
author: Groucho Marx

text: Animals are such agreeable friends—they ask no questions; they pass no criticisms.
author: George Eliot

text: Until one has loved an animal, a part of one's soul remains unawakened.
author: Anatole France

text: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
author: John Muir

text: The best thing about animals is that they don't talk much.
author: Thornton Wilder

text: The dog is a gentleman; I hope to go to his heaven, not man's.
author: Mark Twain

text: One cannot help being touched by the unconditional love animals give.
author: Anatole France

text: A horse! A horse! My kingdom for a horse!
author: William Shakespeare

text: Birds sing after a storm. Why shouldn't people feel as free to delight in whatever remains to them?
author: Rose Kennedy

text: Whoever said you can’t buy happiness forgot little puppies.
author: Gene Hill

text: Time spent with cats is never wasted.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: The early bird catches the worm.
author: English Proverb

text: The owl of Minerva spreads its wings only with the falling of the dusk.
author: Hegel

text: The bird is powered by its own life and by its motivation.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

text: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge.
author: Psalm 91:4

text: The bee is more honored than other animals, not because she labors, but because she labors for others.
author: Saint John Chrysostom

text: If you want loyalty, get a dog. If you want loyalty and attention, get a smart dog.
author: Grant Fairley

text: The wolf that one hears is worse than the orc that one fears.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Dogs have boundless enthusiasm but no sense of shame. I should have a dog as a life coach.
author: Moby

text: Animals never worry about heaven or hell. Neither do I. Maybe that's why we get along.
author: Charles Bukowski

text: The strength of the pack is the wolf, and the strength of the wolf is the pack.
author: Rudyard Kipling

text: God made the cat to give man the pleasure of stroking a tiger.
author: François-Joseph Méry

text: I’ve never met an animal I didn’t like, and I can’t say the same thing about people.
author: Doris Day

text: The smallest feline is a masterpiece.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.
author: Winston Churchill

text: I wonder if other dogs think poodles are members of a weird religious cult.
author: Rita Rudner

text: Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a function.
author: Garrison Keillor

text: Dogs come when they’re called; cats take a message and get back to you.
author: Mary Bly

text: What greater gift than the love of a cat.
author: Charles Dickens

text: A kitten is, in the animal world, what a rosebud is in the garden.
author: Robert Southey

text: A dog is the only thing on earth that loves you more than you love yourself.
author: Josh Billings

text: Animals are reliable, many full of love, true in their affections, predictable in their actions, grateful and loyal. Difficult standards for people to live up to.
author: Alfred A. Montapert

text: Some of my best leading men have been dogs and horses.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

text: Cats seem to go on the principle that it never does any harm to ask for what you want.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

text: The better I get to know men, the more I find myself loving dogs.
author: Charles de Gaulle

text: The wild, cruel beast is not behind the bars of the cage. He is in front of it.
author: Axel Munthe

text: Dogs are not our whole life, but they make our lives whole.
author: Roger Caras

text: Animals share with us the privilege of having a soul.
author: Pythagoras

text: An animal's eyes have the power to speak a great language.
author: Martin Buber

text: If animals could speak, the dog would be a blundering outspoken fellow; but the cat would have the rare grace of never saying a word too much.
author: Mark Twain

text: To err is human—to forgive, canine.
author: Anonymous

text: You think those dogs will not be in heaven! I tell you they will be there long before any of us.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: Dogs never bite me. Just humans.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: A bird sitting on a tree is never afraid of the branch breaking because her trust is not in the branch but in her own wings.
author: Unknown Proverb

text: If a man aspires towards a righteous life, his first act of abstinence is from injury to animals.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: I am in favor of animal rights as well as human rights. That is the way of a whole human being.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: There are two means of refuge from the misery of life—music and cats.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: The bird fights its way out of the egg. The egg is the world. Who would be born must destroy a world.
author: Hermann Hesse

text: You can judge a man's true character by the way he treats his fellow animals.
author: Paul McCartney

text: Until one has loved an animal, a part of one's soul remains unawakened.
author: Anatole France

text: If you hold a cat by the tail, you learn things you cannot learn any other way.
author: Mark Twain

text: Money can buy you a fine dog, but only love can make him wag his tail.
author: Kinky Friedman

text: No one appreciates the very special genius of your conversation as the dog does.
author: Christopher Morley

text: Ever consider what dogs must think of us? We come back from a grocery store with the most amazing haul—chicken, pork, half a cow. They must think we're the greatest hunters on earth!
author: Anne Tyler

text: Cats are connoisseurs of comfort.
author: James Herriot

text: For the strength of the Pack is the Wolf, and the strength of the Wolf is the Pack.
author: Rudyard Kipling

text: If you have men who will exclude any of God's creatures from the shelter of compassion and pity, you will have men who will deal likewise with their fellow men.
author: St. Francis of Assisi

text: Dogs teach us a very important lesson in life: The mailman is not to be trusted.
author: Sian Ford

text: To my mind, the life of a lamb is no less precious than that of a human being.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: An animal’s eyes speak a language more eloquent than words.
author: Unknown

text: Every dog has his day.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: Hold fast to dreams, for if dreams die, life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly.
author: Langston Hughes

text: If a dog will not come to you after having looked you in the face, you should go home and examine your conscience.
author: Woodrow Wilson

text: It takes nothing away from a human to be kind to an animal.
author: Joaquin Phoenix

text: Like a bird singing in the rain, let grateful memories survive in time of sorrow.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: In ancient times, cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: The greatness of humanity is not in being human, but in being humane.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The fate of animals is of far greater importance to me than the fear of appearing ridiculous.
author: Émile Zola

text: A horse never runs so fast as when he has other horses to catch up and outpace.
author: Ovid

text: Be like the bird who, pausing in her flight awhile on boughs too slight, feels them give way beneath her and yet sings, knowing she hath wings.
author: Victor Hugo

text: The lion is most handsome when looking for food.
author: Rumi

text: Cats choose us; we don’t own them.
author: Kristin Cast

text: Animals are born who they are, accept it, and that is that. They live with greater peace than people do.
author: Gregory Maguire

text: If having a soul means being able to feel love, loyalty, and gratitude, then animals are better off than a lot of humans.
author: James Herriot

text: A bird doesn’t sing because it has an answer, it sings because it has a song.
author: Maya Angelou

text: When elephants fight, it is the grass that suffers.
author: African proverb

text: There is no psychiatrist in the world like a puppy licking your face.
author: Ben Williams

text: The bird of paradise alights only on the hand that does not grasp.
author: John Berry

text: The owl, that bird of onomatopoetic name, is a repetitious question wrapped in feathers.
author: Gertrude Stein

text: The dog lives for the day, the hour, even the moment.
author: Robert Falcon Scott
